definition: lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]
to wash/to bathe/to develop (photo)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Ju Feng trained Jin Sheng, let his gain want gain money to wash his hands with respect to golden basin.
sentences.chinese: 鞠楓訓練了金勝，讓他賺到想要賺到錢就金盆洗手。

sentences.english: On the YouJunDa says he is innocent, since after wash.
sentences.chinese: 尤俊達當場表示自己是清白的，自從金盆洗手之後。

sentences.english: Gray represents non-involvement, giving it a formal authority.
sentences.chinese: 灰色代表金盆洗手，放棄形式上的權力。

sentences.english: You said you got out when we met in France.
sentences.chinese: 你說我們在法國相遇之後你就金盆洗手了。

definition: to totally stop doing something/to reform one's ways
(of a person) to return to the fray after a period of inactivity/to jump back into the thick of things/(of sth that was once popular) to be resurrected/to make a comeback
to resume one's old trade (idiom)
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to retire (from society, esp. from politics)/to vanish
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself

rivers and lakes/all corners of the country/remote areas to which hermits retreat/section of society operating independently of mainstream society, out of reach of the law/the milieu in which wuxia tales play out (cf. 武俠|武侠[wu3 xia2])/(in late imperial times) world of traveling merchants, itinerant doctors, fortune tellers etc/demimonde/(in modern times) triads/secret gangster societies/underworld
dark road/criminal ways/the underworld/see also 白道[bai2 dao4]
to remove armor and return to the farm/to return to civilian life
to be released from prison
to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
to win success and recognition (idiom)
